summary: This is a law enforcement report generated on August 14, 2019, in response to a subpoena, detailing records of online posts from August 10, 2019, related to Jeffrey Epstein's death. The report includes timestamps, IP addresses, and the content of posts from an anonymous user claiming to have witnessed suspicious activity at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on the night of Epstein's death, including an unrecorded vehicle and a possible switch.

persons.name: Nicolas Roos
persons.context: The report was generated on request by Nicolas Roos for Case ID 2019R01059, indicating he is a law enforcement official involved in the investigation.

persons.name: Anonymous
persons.context: An anonymous user posted on online message boards describing suspicious events at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on the night of Jeffrey Epstein's death, including an unlogged vehicle and a person in military attire.

events.title: Online posts about Epstein's death
events.description: Multiple anonymous posts were made on online message boards (specifically /pol/) describing suspicious activity at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on the night of Jeffrey Epstein's death, including an unrecorded vehicle arrival and a possible prisoner switch.

events.title: Deletion of online post
events.description: A post (No. 222520257) from IP 172.58.139.162, which was a reply to another post, was deleted at 09:46:22 EDT. The report notes the deletion was cleared as 'this entry doesn't correspond to a deletion.'

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (implied from context of posts about a prison count, medical, and a cell)
keyFacts: The document is a law enforcement report generated on August 14, 2019, in response to a subpoena for records related to Case ID 2019R01059.
It details four specific online posts made on August 10, 2019, from two IP addresses (107.77.223.177 and 172.58.139.162), with timestamps between 08:16 and 08:47 EDT.

The content of the posts, from an anonymous user, alleges that after a 4:15 AM count, Jeffrey Epstein was taken to medical in a wheelchair, an unlogged 'trip van' arrived without signing in, and a person in a 'green dress military outfit' was in the van, leading the poster to speculate 'they switched him out' before his reported suicide.
One of the posts (222520257) was deleted later on August 10, 2019, but the report's deletion record indicates it was 'Cleared: this entry doesn't correspond to a deletion.'
The report captures early online speculation and potential witness accounts regarding the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's death, which were of immediate interest to law enforcement.
